articles.headline: How a Prosecutor Addressed a Mostly White Jury and Won a Conviction in the Arbery Case
articles.snippet: Linda Dunikoski, a prosecutor brought in from the Atlanta area, struck a careful tone in a case that many saw as an obvious act of racial violence.
articles.abstract: Linda Dunikoski, a prosecutor brought in from the Atlanta area, struck a careful tone in a case that many saw as an obvious act of racial violence.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUNSWICK, Ga. — The lawyer was from out of town, a prosecutor who had spent the bulk of her career in a large, liberal city, and she had been brought in to try the biggest case of her career: the murder of a Black man on a sunny afternoon by three white men just outside a small city pinned to the South Georgia coastline.

articles.headline: That ‘Team Beto’ Fund-Raising Email? It Might Not Be From Beto.
articles.snippet: Mimicking official correspondence is an age-old marketing trick. But look-alike emails suggesting links to Beto O’Rourke’s campaign for governor show the tactic has accelerated in the digital era.
articles.abstract: Mimicking official correspondence is an age-old marketing trick. But look-alike emails suggesting links to Beto O’Rourke’s campaign for governor show the tactic has accelerated in the digital era.
articles.lead_paragraph: Kenneth Pennington, a top digital strategist for Beto O’Rourke, had a simple plan.

articles.headline: Time, Money and Chicken Fat: A Guide to Inflation-Proof Gift-Giving
articles.snippet: Prices are soaring for almost everything, but a few choice gifts are even cheaper than two years ago. Or show your love by going on your family’s annual “lard run.”
articles.abstract: Prices are soaring for almost everything, but a few choice gifts are even cheaper than two years ago. Or show your love by going on your family’s annual “lard run.”
articles.lead_paragraph: If groceries, gas or automobiles were any part of your budget this year, inflation has hit you hard. Now perhaps you want to keep the gift budget in check. Then again, maybe you haven’t seen your relatives in a long while, and you’d rather not be anything less than generous.

articles.headline: The Holiday Shopping Season Is Here, but Is It Back?
articles.snippet: Shoppers are returning to stores in much bigger numbers than last year, but the atmosphere is not quite as carefree as the prepandemic days of 2019.
articles.abstract: Shoppers are returning to stores in much bigger numbers than last year, but the atmosphere is not quite as carefree as the prepandemic days of 2019.
articles.lead_paragraph: Americans more comfortable with in-store shopping were back out in greater force on Friday, and battered retailers were more optimistic than they have been at any point since the start of the pandemic, which shuttered stores and wiped out sales.

articles.headline: Markets Tumble as New Coronavirus Variant Brings Travel Restrictions
articles.snippet: Stocks and oil futures slumped, while investors sought safety in government bonds.
articles.abstract: Stocks and oil futures slumped, while investors sought safety in government bonds.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stocks around the world fell on Friday and oil prices plunged, after evidence of a new coronavirus variant in South Africa prompted another round of travel restrictions and reignited concerns about the economic toll imposed by the pandemic.
